intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium paurocyma, commonly known as the paleleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and basal rosettes of narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which bloom in early summer. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium paurocyma is a perennial species that thrives in temperate climates.
